en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 24

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is from the Friday October 24, 1828 session of court, during which two criminal cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 24 : page 1

body.value: October & November Term 1828 Friday 24th The Court met and formed a quoram quorum Present Andrew Ross , John Huss , and Walter L. Adair Judges The Court have duly elected Elijah Hicks clerk of said Court. The Cherokee Nation vs Robert Saunders & Wayahuttah Wolf Prosecutor charged with stealing money The court acquits the defendants The Nation Chee, wo, Rul, ler pro. prosecutor vs Beaver Carrier Stealing- Court find the deft. defendant Beaver Carrier guilty and sentence him to twenty five lashes- and give him judgment in favour favor of the prosecutor ten dollars & Costs- Witness The Fencer 14 days $10.50 The Court adjourned till 10 Oclock tomorrow-
